Real Estate Notary

Mobile Notary for Real Estate Documents in Los Angeles

Whether you are closing on a home, transferring property to family, or refinancing, we come to your home, office, or escrow company to notarize real estate documents on your schedule.

Serving buyers, sellers, investors, and escrow companies across Los Angeles County for deeds, loan documents, and property transfers.

Call or Text (213) 933‑2507 Schedule Real Estate Notary
Why it matters

Real Estate Deadlines Are Time-Sensitive

Real estate transactions run on strict timelines. Loan rate locks, escrow deadlines, and recording cutoffs mean your documents must be signed and notarized correctly the first time.

  • Even a single missed signature can delay closing or recording.
  • Deeds and deeds of trust usually must be notarized before the county will record them.
  • Certain real property documents require a thumbprint in the notary journal under California law.

Who we help

  • Home buyers and sellers who need a notary at home, work, or a neutral location.
  • Investors and landlords handling multiple properties or 1031 exchanges.
  • Escrow officers and realtors who need a reliable mobile notary partner.
  • Families handling inter-family transfers, adding or removing someone from title, or trust funding.

We coordinate with your escrow, lender, or attorney so your signing is fast, accurate, and aligned with your closing timeline.

Documents we notarize

Common Real Estate Documents

Deeds & title documents

  • Grant deeds and interspousal grant deeds
  • Quitclaim deeds for adding or removing someone from title
  • Property transfer and gift deeds
  • Trust transfer deeds (funding a trust)
  • Affidavits related to title or vesting

Loan & refinancing documents

  • Deeds of trust / mortgage documents
  • Promissory notes (signature acknowledgment only, no legal advice)
  • Loan modification and refinance packages
  • Home Equity Line of Credit (HELOC) documents
  • Subordination and reconveyance documents

Seller and escrow paperwork

  • Seller’s grant deed and related forms
  • Affidavit of title and identity statements
  • Escrow instructions and settlement documents
  • Release of lien or deed of reconveyance

Other property documents

  • Commercial lease guarantees and consents
  • Landlord and tenant agreements
  • Private financing / hard money loan documents
  • Any document your escrow, lender, or attorney prepares that requires notarization
How it works

Scheduling a Real Estate Notary Appointment

1. Share your signing details

Call, text, or have your escrow officer reach out with the property address, type of transaction (purchase, sale, refinance, transfer), and your preferred signing date and time.

2. Confirm documents and ID

We confirm which documents require notarization, how many signers there are, and what ID each signer will use. For real property documents, we also confirm thumbprint requirements in the notary journal.

3. Choose the signing location

We can meet at your home, workplace, escrow office, a coffee shop, or another convenient location in Los Angeles County. Everyone who needs to sign must be present with valid ID.

4. Review and sign documents

You or your escrow / lender prepare the documents. We verify identity, witness signatures, complete the notarial certificates, and obtain any required thumbprints in our journal for documents affecting real property.

5. Return to escrow or your chosen recipient

Once the signing is complete, we can return documents directly to your escrow company, attorney, or lender, or leave them with you with clear instructions on where to deliver or ship them.

Call or Text (213) 933‑2507 Schedule Appointment

Tight closing date or rate lock? Mention your deadline when you reach out so we can prioritize scheduling and make sure your documents are signed in time.

Pricing

Real Estate Notary Fees

Real estate signings range from a simple deed notarization to a full loan package. Pricing depends on the number of notarized signatures, travel distance, and how long the appointment will take.

  • Single-property deeds and transfers: Typically a standard mobile notary visit with travel plus per-signature fees.
  • Loan signings / refinance packages: Flat or time-based pricing depending on package size and distance.
  • Additional signers, multiple properties, or off-hour appointments may have adjusted fees.

What is included

  • Travel to your chosen signing location in Los Angeles County
  • Identity verification for each signer and journal entries
  • Completion of California-compliant acknowledgment or jurat certificates
  • Thumbprints for documents affecting real property, when required by law
  • Optional document return to escrow, lender, or attorney

For an exact quote, share your property location, number of signers, and whether this is a deed only or a full loan package.

Common Questions

Real Estate Notary FAQs

Can you explain my loan documents?

We are not attorneys or loan officers and cannot give legal or financial advice. We can point out where to sign and notarize your signature, but any questions about terms, rates, or legal effect should be answered by your lender, escrow officer, or attorney.

Do I need witnesses for my real estate documents?

Most California real estate documents do not require witnesses beyond the notary. Some out‑of‑state or lender-specific documents may request witnesses; let us know ahead of time if your documents mention witnesses so we can plan accordingly.

Can you notarize for out-of-state properties?

Yes. As long as the notarization itself follows California notary law and is performed in California, the documents can relate to property in another state. Your escrow or attorney can confirm any state-specific formatting they require.

Can you handle last-minute signings?

Often, yes. Real estate timelines can change quickly. Call or text with your deadline, and we will let you know the soonest available time for a signing.

Do you work directly with escrow companies?

Yes. We frequently coordinate directly with escrow officers, who send the documents to us or to you ahead of time. This helps make the signing smoother and ensures everything needed is ready at the appointment.
